name: USkeletalMeshComponent

GlobalAnimRateScale: Used to scale speed of all animations on this skeletal mesh.
KinematicBonesUpdateType: If we are running physics, should we update non-simulated bones based on the animation bone positions.
PhysicsTransformUpdateMode: Whether physics simulation updates component transform.
ClothVelocityScale:
Scale applied to the component induced velocity of all cloth particles prior to stepping the cloth solver.
Use 1.0 for fully induced velocity (default), or use 0.0 for no induced velocity, and any other values in between for a reduced induced velocity.
When set to 0.0, it also provides a way to force the clothing to simulate in local space.
This value multiplies to individual cloth's velocity scale settings, still allowing for differences in behavior between the various pieces of clothing within the same component.
ClothBlendWeight:
weight to blend between simulated results and key-framed positions
if weight is 1.0, shows only cloth simulation results and 0.0 will show only skinned results
bWaitForParallelClothTask:
Whether we should stall the Cloth tick task until the cloth simulation is complete. This is required if we want up-to-date
cloth data on the game thread, for example if we want to generate particles at cloth vertices.
OnPlasticDeformation: Notification when constraint plasticity drive target changes.
ClothingSimulationFactory: Class of the object responsible for
OnAnimInitialized: Broadcast when the components anim instance is initialized
bDisablePostProcessBlueprint:
Controls whether or not this component will evaluate its post process instance. The post-process
Instance is dictated by the skeletal mesh so this is used for per-instance control.
AnimClass: The AnimBlueprint class to use. Use 'SetAnimInstanceClass' to change at runtime.
bUpdateOverlapsOnAnimationFinalize: Controls whether blending in physics bones will refresh overlaps on this component, defaults to true but can be disabled in cases where we know anim->physics blending doesn't meaningfully change overlaps
bEnablePhysicsOnDedicatedServer:
If true, simulate physics for this component on a dedicated server.
This should be set if simulating physics and replicating with a dedicated server.
    Note: This property cannot be changed at runtime.
bUpdateMeshWhenKinematic:
If true, then the physics bodies will be used to drive the skeletal mesh even when they are
kinematic (not simulating), otherwise the skeletal mesh will be driven by the animation input
when the bodies are kinematic
bUpdateJointsFromAnimation:
If we should pass joint position to joints each frame, so that they can be used by motorized joints to drive the
ragdoll based on the animation.
bAllowClothActors:
Toggles creation of cloth simulation. Distinct from the simulation toggle below in that, if off, avoids allocating
the actors entirely instead of just skipping the simulation step.
bDisableClothSimulation: Disable cloth simulation and play original animation without simulation
bDisableRigidBodyAnimNode: Disable rigid body animation nodes and play original animation without simulation
bAllowAnimCurveEvaluation: Disable animation curves for this component. If this is set true, no curves will be processed
bCollideWithEnvironment: can't collide with part of environment if total collision volumes exceed 16 capsules or 32 planes per convex
bCollideWithAttachedChildren: can't collide with part of attached children if total collision volumes exceed 16 capsules or 32 planes per convex
bForceCollisionUpdate:
Forces the cloth simulation to constantly update its external collisions, at the expense of performance.
This will help to prevent missed collisions if the cloth's skeletal mesh component isn't moving,
and when instead, wind or other moving objects are causing new collision shapes to come into the cloth's vicinity.
bResetAfterTeleport: reset the clothing after moving the clothing position (called teleport)
bDeferKinematicBoneUpdate: Whether animation and world transform updates are deferred. If this is on, the kinematic bodies (scene query data) will not update until the next time the physics simulation is run
bPauseAnims: pauses this component's animations (doesn't tick them, but still refreshes bones)
bUseRefPoseOnInitAnim: On InitAnim should we set to ref pose (if false use first tick of animation data). If enabled, takes precedence over UAnimationSettings::bTickAnimationOnSkeletalMeshInit
bEnablePerPolyCollision: Uses skinned data for collision data.
bIncludeComponentLocationIntoBounds:
If true, the Location of this Component will be included into its bounds calculation
(this can be useful when using SMU_OnlyTickPoseWhenRendered on a character that moves away from the root and no bones are left near the origin of the component)
bPropagateCurvesToFollowers: If true, propagates calls to ApplyAnimationCurvesToComponent for follower components, only needed if follower components do not tick themselves
bSkipKinematicUpdateWhenInterpolating: Whether to skip UpdateKinematicBonesToAnim() when interpolating. Kinematic bones are updated to the target interpolation pose only on ticks when they are evaluated.
bSkipBoundsUpdateWhenInterpolating: Whether to skip bounds update when interpolating. Bounds are updated to the target interpolation pose only on ticks when they are evaluated.
bUpdateAnimationInEditor: If true, this will Tick until disabled
bUpdateClothInEditor: If true, will play cloth in editor
bOverrideDefaultAnimatingRig: If true, DefaultAnimatingRigOverride will be used. If false, use the DefaultAnimatingRig in the SkeletalMesh

methods.name: AccumulateAllBodiesBelowPhysicsBlendWeight
methods.doc: Accumulate AddPhysicsBlendWeight to physics blendweight for all of the bones below passed in bone to be simulated

methods.name: AddForceToAllBodiesBelow
AddImpulseToAllBodiesBelow
BindClothToLeaderPoseComponent
methods.doc:
If this component has a valid LeaderPoseComponent then this function makes cloth items on the follower component
take the transforms of the cloth items on the leader component instead of simulating separately.
@Note This will FORCE any cloth actor on the leader component to simulate in local space. Also
The meshes used in the components must be identical for the cloth to bind correctly

methods.name: BreakConstraint
ClearMorphTargets
methods.doc: Clear all Morph Target that are set to this mesh

methods.name: FindConstraintBoneName
ForceClothNextUpdateTeleport
methods.doc:
Used to indicate we should force 'teleport' during the next call to UpdateClothState,
This will transform positions and velocities and thus keep the simulation state, just translate it to a new pose.

methods.name: ForceClothNextUpdateTeleportAndReset
methods.doc:
Used to indicate we should force 'teleport and reset' during the next call to UpdateClothState.
This can be used to reset it from a bad state or by a teleport where the old state is not important anymore.

methods.name: GetAnimInstance
methods.doc:
Returns the animation instance that is driving the class (if available). This is typically an instance of
the class set as AnimBlueprintGeneratedClass (generated by an animation blueprint)
Since this instance is transient, it is not safe to be used during construction script

methods.name: GetBoneMass
GetClothingSimulationInteractor
methods.doc: Get the current interactor for a clothing simulation, if the current simulation supports runtime interaction.

methods.name: GetClothMaxDistanceScale
methods.doc: Get/Set the max distance scale of clothing mesh vertices

methods.name: GetConstraintByName
GetConstraints
GetConstraintsFromBody
GetCurrentJointAngles
GetDisablePostProcessBlueprint
methods.doc: Gets whether the post process blueprint is currently disabled for this component

methods.doc:
Returns the a tagged linked instance node. If no linked instances are found or none are tagged with the
supplied name, this will return NULL.

methods.name: GetLinkedAnimLayerInstanceByClass

methods.name: GetLinkedAnimLayerInstanceByGroup
methods.doc: Gets the layer linked instance corresponding to the specified group

methods.name: GetMorphTarget
methods.doc: Get Morph target with given name

methods.name: GetPlayRate
methods.doc:
Animation play functions
      *
      * These changes status of animation instance, which is transient data, which means it won't serialize with this component
      * Because of that reason, it is not safe to be used during construction script
      * Please use OverrideAnimationData for construction script. That will override AnimationData to be serialized

methods.name: GetPostProcessInstance
methods.doc:
Returns the active post process instance is one is available. This is set on the mesh that this
component is using, and is evaluated immediately after the main instance.

methods.name: GetSkeletalCenterOfMass
methods.doc: Returns the center of mass of the skeletal mesh, instead of the root body's location

methods.name: GetSkeletalMeshAsset
methods.doc: Get the SkeletalMesh rendered for this mesh.

methods.name: GetStringAttribute
GetStringAttribute_Ref
GetTeleportDistanceThreshold
methods.doc:
Gets the teleportation distance threshold.

@return Threshold value.

methods.name: GetTeleportRotationThreshold
methods.doc:
Gets the teleportation rotation threshold.

@return Threshold in degrees.

methods.name: GetTransformAttribute
GetTransformAttribute_Ref
HasValidAnimationInstance
methods.doc:
Returns whether there are any valid instances to run, currently this means whether we have
have an animation instance or a post process instance available to process.

methods.name: IsBodyGravityEnabled
IsClothingSimulationSuspended
methods.doc: Gets whether or not the clothing simulation is currently suspended

methods.name: IsPlaying
methods.doc:
Animation play functions
      *
      * These changes status of animation instance, which is transient data, which means it won't serialize with this component
      * Because of that reason, it is not safe to be used during construction script
      * Please use OverrideAnimationData for construction script. That will override AnimationData to be serialized

methods.name: GetClosestPointOnPhysicsAsset
LinkAnimClassLayers
methods.doc:
Runs through all layer nodes, attempting to find layer nodes that are implemented by the specified class, then sets up a linked instance of the class for each.
Allocates one linked instance to run each of the groups specified in the class, so state is shared. If a layer is not grouped (ie. NAME_None), then state is not shared
and a separate linked instance is allocated for each layer node.
If InClass is null, then all layers are reset to their defaults.

methods.name: LinkAnimGraphByTag
methods.doc: Runs through all nodes, attempting to find linked instance by name/tag, then sets the class of each node if the tag matches

methods.name: OverrideAnimationData
methods.doc:
This overrides current AnimationData parameter in the SkeletalMeshComponent. This will serialize when the component serialize
so it can be used during construction script. However note that this will override current existing data
This can be useful if you'd like to make a blueprint with custom default animation per component
This sets single player mode, which means you can't use AnimBlueprint with it

methods.name: Play
methods.doc:
Animation play functions
      *

      * Because of that reason, it is not safe to be used during construction script
      * Please use OverrideAnimationData for construction script. That will override AnimationData to be serialized

methods.name: PlayAnimation
methods.doc:
Animation play functions
       *
       * These changes status of animation instance, which is transient data, which means it won't serialize with this component
       * Because of that reason, it is not safe to be used during construction script

methods.name: ResetAllBodiesSimulatePhysics
methods.doc: Allows you to reset bodies Simulate state based on where bUsePhysics is set to true in the BodySetup.

methods.name: ResetAllowedAnimCurveEvaluation
methods.doc: By reset, it will allow all the curves to be evaluated

methods.name: ResetAnimInstanceDynamics
methods.doc:
Informs any active anim instances (main instance, linked instances, post instance) that a dynamics reset is required
for example if a teleport occurs.

methods.name: ResetClothTeleportMode
methods.doc: Reset the teleport mode of a next update to 'Continuous'

methods.name: ResumeClothingSimulation
methods.doc: Resumes a previously suspended clothing simulation, teleporting the clothing on the next tick

methods.name: SetAllBodiesBelowLinearVelocity
methods.doc: set the linear velocity of the child bodies to match that of the given parent bone

methods.name: SetAllBodiesBelowPhysicsBlendWeight
methods.doc: Set all of the bones below passed in bone to be simulated

methods.name: SetAllBodiesBelowPhysicsDisabled
methods.doc:
[WARNING: Chaos Only]
Set all of the bones below passed in bone to be disabled or not for the associated physics solver
Bodies will not be colliding or be part of the physics simulation.
This is different from SetAllBodiesBelowSimulatePhysics that changes bodies to Kinematic/simulated

methods.name: SetAllBodiesBelowSimulatePhysics
methods.doc: Set all of the bones below passed in bone to be simulated

methods.name: SetAllBodiesSimulatePhysics
methods.doc: Set bSimulatePhysics to true for all bone bodies. Does not change the component bSimulatePhysics flag.

methods.name: SetAllMotorsAngularDriveParams
methods.doc: Set Angular Drive motors params for all constraint instances

methods.name: SetAllMotorsAngularPositionDrive
methods.doc: Enable or Disable AngularPositionDrive. If motor is in SLERP mode it will be turned on if either EnableSwingDrive OR EnableTwistDrive are enabled. In Twist and Swing mode the twist and the swing can be controlled individually.

methods.name: SetAllMotorsAngularVelocityDrive
methods.doc: Enable or Disable AngularVelocityDrive. If motor is in SLERP mode it will be turned on if either EnableSwingDrive OR EnableTwistDrive are enabled. In Twist and Swing mode the twist and the swing can be controlled individually.

methods.name: SetAllowClothActors
SetAllowedAnimCurvesEvaluation
methods.doc: resets, and then only allow the following list to be allowed/disallowed

methods.name: SetAllowRigidBodyAnimNode
methods.doc: Sets whether or not to allow rigid body animation nodes for this component

methods.name: SetAngularLimits
SetAnimation
methods.doc:
Animation play functions
      *
      * These changes status of animation instance, which is transient data, which means it won't serialize with this component
      * Because of that reason, it is not safe to be used during construction script
      * Please use OverrideAnimationData for construction script. That will override AnimationData to be serialized

methods.name: SetAnimationMode
SetAnimClass
methods.doc: Set the anim instance class. Clears and re-initializes the anim instance with the new class and sets animation mode to 'AnimationBlueprint'

methods.name: SetBodyNotifyRigidBodyCollision
SetBodySimulatePhysics
methods.doc: Set a single bone to be simulated (or not)

methods.name: SetConstraintProfile
methods.doc: Sets the constraint profile properties (limits, motors, etc...) to match the constraint profile as defined in the physics asset. If profile name is not found the joint is set to use the default constraint profile.

methods.name: SetConstraintProfileForAll
methods.doc: Sets the constraint profile properties (limits, motors, etc...) to match the constraint profile as defined in the physics asset for all constraints. If profile name is not found the joint is set to use the default constraint profile.

methods.name: SetDisablePostProcessBlueprint
methods.doc:
Sets whether the post process blueprint is currently running for this component.
If it is not currently running, and is set to run, the instance will be reinitialized

methods.name: SetEnableBodyGravity
SetEnableGravityOnAllBodiesBelow
SetEnablePhysicsBlending
methods.doc: Disable physics blending of bones *

methods.name: SetMorphTarget
methods.doc:
Set Morph Target with Name and Value(0-1)

@param bRemoveZeroWeight : Used by editor code when it should stay in the active list with zero weight

methods.name: SetNotifyRigidBodyCollisionBelow
SetPhysicsBlendWeight
methods.doc:
This is global set up for setting physics blend weight
This does multiple things automatically
If PhysicsBlendWeight == 1.f, it will enable Simulation, and if PhysicsBlendWeight == 0.f, it will disable Simulation.
Also it will respect each body's setup, so if the body is fixed, it won't simulate. Vice versa
So if you'd like all bodies to change manually, do not use this function, but SetAllBodiesPhysicsBlendWeight

      * Because of that reason, it is not safe to be used during construction script

methods.name: SetSkeletalMeshAsset
methods.doc: Set the SkeletalMesh rendered for this mesh.

methods.name: SetTeleportDistanceThreshold
methods.doc:
Sets the teleportation distance threshold.

@param threshold Threshold value.

methods.name: SetTeleportRotationThreshold
methods.doc:
Sets the teleportation rotation threshold.

@param threshold Threshold in degrees.

methods.name: SetUpdateAnimationInEditor
methods.doc:
Sets whether or not to force tick component in order to update animation and refresh transform for this component
This is supported only in the editor

methods.name: SetUpdateClothInEditor
methods.doc:
Sets whether or not to animate cloth in the editor. Requires Update Animation In Editor to also be true.
This is supported only in the editor

methods.name: SnapshotPose
methods.doc:
Takes a snapshot of this skeletal mesh component's pose and saves it to the specified snapshot.
The snapshot is taken at the current LOD, so if for example you took the snapshot at LOD1
and then used it at LOD0 any bones not in LOD1 will use the reference pose

methods.name: Stop
methods.doc:
Animation play functions
      *
      * These changes status of animation instance, which is transient data, which means it won't serialize with this component
      * Because of that reason, it is not safe to be used during construction script
      * Please use OverrideAnimationData for construction script. That will override AnimationData to be serialized

methods.name: SuspendClothingSimulation
methods.doc: Stops simulating clothing, but does not show clothing ref pose. Keeps the last known simulation state

methods.name: TermBodiesBelow
methods.doc: Terminate physics on all bodies below the named bone, effectively disabling collision forever. If you terminate, you won't be able to re-init later.

methods.name: ToggleDisablePostProcessBlueprint
methods.doc: Toggles whether the post process blueprint will run for this component

methods.name: UnbindClothFromLeaderPoseComponent
methods.doc:
If this component has a valid LeaderPoseComponent and has previously had its cloth bound to the
MCP, this function will unbind the cloth and resume simulation.
@param bRestoreSimulationSpace if true and the leader pose cloth was originally simulating in world
space, we will restore this setting. This will cause the leader component to reset which may be
undesirable.

methods.name: UnlinkAnimClassLayers
methods.doc:
Runs through all layer nodes, attempting to find layer nodes that are currently running the specified class, then resets each to its default value.
State sharing rules are as with SetLayerOverlay.
If InClass is null, does nothing.
